title: 'None' gradient wrt to the input using TF2, Embeddings and GradientExplainer.

labels.name: todo
labels.description: This issue had an outstanding action to take.

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Indicates that a maintainer wants help on an issue or pull request

body:
Hi! I get this error using GradientExplainer with the Embedding layer of tf.keras.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:/Users/disimone/PycharmProjects/shap/notebooks/deep_explainer/Keras LSTM for IMDB Sentiment Classification.py", line 71, in <module>
    shap_values = explainer.shap_values(x_test[:10])
  File "C:\Users\disimone\PycharmProjects\shap\shap\explainers\gradient.py", line 106, in shap_values
    return self.explainer.shap_values(X, nsamples, ranked_outputs, output_rank_order, rseed, return_variances)
  File "C:\Users\disimone\PycharmProjects\shap\shap\explainers\gradient.py", line 288, in shap_values
    grad = [np.concatenate([g[l] for g in grads], 0) for l in range(len(X))]
  File "C:\Users\disimone\PycharmProjects\shap\shap\explainers\gradient.py", line 288, in <listcomp>
    grad = [np.concatenate([g[l] for g in grads], 0) for l in range(len(X))]
  File "<__array_function__ internals>", line 6, in concatenate
ValueError: zero-dimensional arrays cannot be concatenated
```

I have this error because `tf.GradientTape` in `_TFGradientExplainer` return `None` as gradient with respect to the input.

https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/a270b811a8147e12655842ddeb226b4ebae39f72/shap/explainers/gradient.py#L209

One possible solution would be to compute the SHAP values of the input of the LSTM layer (the output of the Embedding layer), but its a dirty fix. Do you have any other idea on how to fix this issue?

As a 'minimal' working example I modified the notebook 'Keras LSTM for IMDB Sentiment Classification'. Below a link to the Colab Notebook.

https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1bSI4XoHBXcxaj2n6gaZu2xaigbhuiezz
